intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis ornata, commonly known as the Orchid of the Andes, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapting to the humid and shaded conditions of its natural habitat. Pleurothallis ornata is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and relatively easy care requirements.
